Cost: 7,452

Class com.googlecode.fspotcloud.grapher.Main is hard to test because:

It is expensive to construct an instance of the class, and every test will need to call a constructor.

Static methods are called in constructor Why is it bad?

On line 13, static method Injector createInjector(Module[]) is called contributing 24% of total class cost

This couples every test to use the code in the static method. Refactor the static method to be an instance method on the class.

Constructors with a high cyclomatic complexity Why is it bad?

On line 10, Main() is complex contributing 24% of total class cost
On line 10, Main() is complex contributing 24% of total class cost

Don't perform work in the constructor. Instead, initialize all the needed state, and pass it as a new parameter.

These collaborators cannot be mocked, so it is impossible to unit test this class in isolation.

Non-mockable collaborators: Why is it bad?

On line 19, Main() is called contributing 24% of total class cost
On line 27, void plot(Injector, String) is called contributing 1% of total class cost
On line 32, Grapher(Injector, String) is called contributing 1% of total class cost
On line 20, void plotAll() is called contributing 1% of total class cost

This method call can't be mocked out from a unit test because the test cannot control how the object is instantiated. This can be caused by: - the object was created using new, - it was returned by a non-mockable collaborator, or - the method is declared final or private, which prevents overriding in a subclass

Cost: 5,020

Class com.googlecode.fspotcloud.grapher.Grapher is hard to test because:

These collaborators cannot be mocked, so it is impossible to unit test this class in isolation.

Static methods are called: Why is it bad?

On line 28, static method Injector createInjector(Module[]) is called contributing 25% of total class cost

Since these static methods are complex, we want to mock them out in the unit test. If they are declared in your code, refactor the methods to be non-static, and inject an instance of the class. Otherwise, you can create a wrapper object.

Non-mockable collaborators: Why is it bad?

On line 38, void graph(String, Injector) is called contributing 36% of total class cost
On line 44, Process exec(String) is called contributing 27% of total class cost
On line 27, PrintWriter(File, String) is called contributing 11% of total class cost

This method call can't be mocked out from a unit test because the test cannot control how the object is instantiated. This can be caused by: - the object was created using new, - it was returned by a non-mockable collaborator, or - the method is declared final or private, which prevents overriding in a subclass
